original: 10 Indriyayamaka
analyzed: indriya yamaka
translated: The Twin Verses on Faculties

original: 10.3 Pariññāvāra🔽10.3.4. Paccuppannātītavāra
analyzed: pariññāvāra
translated: The Chapter on Full Understanding🔽… The Chapter on the Present and Past

original: 10.3.4.1. Anuloma🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so domanassindriyaṁ pajahitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: anuloma  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ domanassindriyam pajahittha ati āmantā
translated: … The Direct Way🔽“Does anyone who fully understands the eye faculty abandon the faculty of grief?” Yes.

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassa indriyam pajahittha so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti
translated: “Or does anyone who abandons the faculty of grief fully understand the eye faculty?”

original: Dve puggalā domanassindriyaṁ pajahittha, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ parijānanti. Aggamaggasamaṅgī domanassindriyañca pajahittha cakkhundriyañca parijānāti.
analyzed: dve puggalā domanassindriyam pajahittha no ca cakkhundriyam parijānanti aggamagga samaṅgī domanassindriyam ca pajahittha cakkhundriyam ca parijānāti
translated: Two persons abandon the faculty of grief but do not fully understand the eye faculty. One in higher training abandons the faculty of grief and fully understands the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha ati āmantā
translated: “Does anyone who fully understands the eye faculty develop the faculty of final knowledge?” Yes.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti
translated: “Or does anyone who develops the faculty of final knowledge fully understand the eye faculty?”

original: Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ parijānanti. Aggamaggasamaṅgī anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha cakkhundriyañca parijānāti.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam bhāvittha no ca cakkhundriyam parijānanti aggamagga samaṅgī anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam ca bhāvittha cakkhundriyam ca parijānāti
translated: Six persons develop the faculty of final knowledge but do not fully understand the eye faculty. One in higher training develops the faculty of final knowledge and fully understands the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so aññindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti so aññindriyam bhāvittha ati no
translated: “Does anyone who has fully understood the eye faculty also develop the other faculty?” No.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvittha so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti? No.🔽Yo cakkhundriyaṁ parijānāti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikaritthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvittha so cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti no  yaḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarittha ati no
translated: “Or does anyone who develops the other faculty also fully understand the eye faculty?” No.🔽“Does anyone who has fully understood the eye faculty also realize the final knowledge of an arahant?” No.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarittha so cakkhundriyaṁ parijānātīti? No. (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarittha saḥ cakkhu indriyam parijānāti iti no cakkhu indriya mūlaka  yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahati saḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha ati āmantā
translated: “Or does anyone who realizes the final knowledge of an arahant also fully understand the eye faculty?” No.🔽“Does anyone who abandons the sorrow faculty also develop the final-knowledge faculty?” Yes.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāvittha saḥ domanassindriyam pajahati iti
translated: “Or does anyone who develops the final-knowledge faculty also abandon the sorrow faculty?”

original: Cha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvittha, no ca domanassindriyaṁ pajahanti. Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca bhāvittha domanassindriyañca pajahati.
analyzed: cha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam bhāvittha no ca domanassindriyam pajahanti anāgāmi magga samaṅgī anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam ca bhāvittha domanassindriyam ca pajahati
translated: Six individuals develop the final-knowledge faculty but do not abandon the sorrow faculty. The one who is possessed of the path of non-return both develops the final-knowledge faculty and abandons the sorrow faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so aññindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam pajahati saḥ aññindriyam bhāvittha ati no
translated: “Does anyone who abandons the sorrow faculty also develop the other faculty?” No.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvittha so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti? No.🔽Yo domanassindriyaṁ pajahati so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikaritthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvittha saḥ domanassindriyam pajahati iti no  yaḥ domanassa indriyam pajahati saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarittha ati no
translated: Or does anyone who develops any other faculty abandon the faculty of grief? No.🔽Does anyone who abandons the faculty of grief realize the faculty of final knowledge? No.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarittha so domanassindriyaṁ pajahatīti? No. (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññindriyaṁ bhāvitthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam sacchikarittha saḥ domanassa indriyam pajahati iti no domanassa indriya mūlaka  yaḥ anaññātaññassāmi itindriyam bhāveti saḥ aññindriyam bhāvittha ati no
translated: Or does anyone who realizes the faculty of final knowledge abandon the faculty of grief? No.🔽(The triad based on the faculty of grief.)🔽Does anyone who develops the faculty of final knowledge as non-final realize the faculty of final knowledge? No.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ bhāvittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvetīti? No.🔽Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikaritthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam bhāvittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam bhāveti iti no  yaḥ an aññāta ñassāmi iti indriyam bhāveti saḥ aññātau indriyam sacchikarittha ati no
translated: Or does anyone who realizes the faculty of final knowledge develop the faculty of final knowledge as non-final? No.🔽Does anyone who develops the faculty of final knowledge as non-final realize the faculty of final knowledge? No.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ bhāvetīti? No. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam sacchikarittha saḥ an aññātaññassāmi iti indriyam bhāveti iti no an aññātaññassāmi iti indriya mūlaka
translated: Or does anyone who realizes the faculty of final knowledge develop the faculty of final knowledge as non-final? No.🔽(The triad based on the faculty of final knowledge as non-final.)

original: Yo aññindriyaṁ bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikaritthāti? No.
analyzed: yaḥ aññindriyam bhāveti saḥ aññātāvindriyam sacchikarittha ati no
translated: Does anyone who develops the faculty of final knowledge realize the faculty of final knowledge? No.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ sacchikarittha so aññindriyaṁ bhāvetīti? No. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)🔽10.3.4.2. Paccanīka
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam sacchikarittha saḥ aññindriyam bhāveti iti no aññindriya mūlaka  paccanīka
translated: Or does anyone who has realized the final-knower faculty also develop the final-knower faculty? No. (The section based on the final-knower faculty.)🔽… the opposite

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahittha ati
translated: Does anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty also not abandon the joy faculty?

original: Dve puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha. Cha puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti domanassindriyañca nappajahittha.
analyzed: dve puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānanti no ca domanassindriyam na pajahittha cha puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti domanassindriyam ca na pajahittha
translated: Two persons do not fully understand the eye faculty but do not abandon the joy faculty. Six persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and do not abandon the joy faculty.

original: Yo vā pana domanassindriyaṁ nappajahittha so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana domanassindriyam na pajahittha saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or does anyone who does not abandon the joy faculty also not fully understand the eye faculty? Yes.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha ati
translated: Does anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty also not develop the final-knower faculty?

original: Cha puggalā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Dve puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: cha puggalā cakkhu indriyam na parijānanti no ca anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam na bhāvittha dve puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti anaññātaññassāmi iti indriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: Six persons do not fully understand the eye faculty but do not not develop the final-knower faculty. Two persons do not fully understand the eye faculty and do not develop the final-knower faculty.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti āmantā
translated: Or does anyone who has not developed the final-knowledge faculty not fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha ati
translated: Anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty has not developed the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Arahā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Satta puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti aññindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: arahā cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvittha satta puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: A perfected one does not fully understand the eye faculty, but has developed the final-knowledge faculty. Seven kinds of person both do not fully understand the eye faculty and have not developed the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvittha so cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or does anyone who has not developed the final-knowledge faculty not fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti. Satta puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvittha cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññindriyam na bhāvittha no ca cakkhundriyam na parijānāti satta puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha cakkhundriyam ca na parijānanti
translated: One who is possessed of the path of arahantship has not developed the final-knowledge faculty, but does not not fully understand the eye faculty. Seven kinds of person both have not developed the final-knowledge faculty and do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Yo cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikaritthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha ati
translated: Anyone who does not fully understand the eye faculty does not realize the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Arahā cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha. Aṭṭha puggalā cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha.
analyzed: arahā cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha aṭṭha puggalā cakkhu indriyam ca na parijānanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarittha
translated: The Worthy One does not fully understand the eye faculty, but does not realise the final knowledge faculty. Eight persons do not fully understand the eye faculty, and do not realise the final knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha so cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānātīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha so cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti iti
translated: Or, whoever does not realise the final knowledge faculty, does he not fully understand the eye faculty?

original: Aggamaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha, no ca cakkhundriyaṁ na parijānāti.
analyzed: aggamagga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha no ca cakkhu indriyam na parijānāti
translated: One who is possessed of the path of a Stream-Enterer does not realise the final knowledge faculty, but he does fully understand the eye faculty.

original: Aṭṭha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha cakkhundriyañca na parijānanti.
analyzed: aṭṭha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha cakkhu indriyañca na parijānanti
translated: Eight persons do not realise the final knowledge faculty, and do not fully understand the eye faculty.

original: (Cakkhundriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: cakkhu indriya mūlaka
translated: (The eye faculty is concluded.)

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam na ppajahati saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha ati
translated: Those who do not abandon the sorrow faculty, do they not develop the final knowledge faculty?

original: Cha puggalā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahanti, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Dve puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: cha puggalā domanassa indriyam na ppajahanti no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha dve puggalā domanassa indriyam ca na ppajahanti anaññātaññassāmītindriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: Six persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty, but do not develop the final knowledge faculty. Two persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty, and do not develop the final knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ domanassindriyam na pajahati iti āmantā
translated: Or does anyone who does not develop the final-knowledge faculty abandon the grief faculty?

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassa indriyam na pajahati saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha ati
translated: Anyone who does not abandon the grief faculty does not develop the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Arahā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Satta puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti aññindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: arahā domanassindriyam na ppajahati no ca aññindriyam na bhāvittha satta puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahanti aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: A perfected being does not abandon the grief faculty but does not not develop the final-knowledge faculty. Seven kinds of persons do not abandon the grief faculty and do not develop the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati iti
translated: Or does anyone who does not develop the final-knowledge faculty not abandon the grief faculty?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati. Satta puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvittha domanassindriyañca nappajahanti.
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī aññindriyam na bhāvittha no ca domanassindriyam na ppajahati satta puggalā aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha domanassindriyam ca na ppajahanti
translated: One possessing the non-return path does not develop the final-knowledge faculty but does not not abandon the grief faculty. Seven kinds of persons do not develop the final-knowledge faculty and do not abandon the grief faculty.

original: Yo domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikaritthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha ati
translated: Anyone who does not abandon the grief faculty does not realize the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Arahā domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha. Aṭṭha puggalā domanassindriyañca nappajahanti aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha.
analyzed: arahā domanassindriyam na ppajahati no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha aṭṭha puggalā domanassindriyam ca na ppajahanti aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarittha
translated: The Adept does not abandon the sorrow faculty, nor does he realize the final knowledge. Eight persons do not abandon the sorrow faculty and do not realize the final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha so domanassindriyaṁ nappajahatīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha saḥ domanassindriyam na ppajahati iti
translated: Or, does anyone who does not realize the final knowledge not abandon the sorrow faculty?

original: Anāgāmimaggasamaṅgī aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha, no ca domanassindriyaṁ nappajahati.
analyzed: anāgāmi magga samaṅgī aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha no ca domanassindriyam na ppajahati
translated: The Non-Returner who possesses the path of non-return does not realize the final knowledge, but he does not abandon the sorrow faculty.

original: Aṭṭha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha domanassindriyañca nappajahanti.
analyzed: aṭṭha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha domanassindriyañca na ppajahanti
translated: Eight persons do not realize the final knowledge and do not abandon the sorrow faculty.

original: (Domanassindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: domanassindriya mūlaka
translated: (The sorrow faculty is the basis for the following:)

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvitthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha ati
translated: Does anyone who does not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty not develop the final-knowledge faculty?

original: Arahā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha. Satta puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāventi aññindriyañca na bhāvittha.
analyzed: arahā anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāveti no ca aññindriyam na bhāvittha satta puggalā anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam ca na bhāventi aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha
translated: The Adept does not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty, but he does not not develop the final-knowledge faculty. Seven persons do not develop the “I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown” faculty and do not develop the final-knowledge faculty.

original: Yo vā pana aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññindriyam na bhāvittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti iti
translated: Or does anyone who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown?

original: Aṭṭhamako aññindriyaṁ na bhāvittha, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti. Satta puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāvittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāventi.
analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ aññindriyam na bhāvittha no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti satta puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca na bhāvittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyam ca na bhāventi
translated: The eighth person does not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but he does not not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown. The seven kinds of persons do not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown, and they do not develop the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikaritthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ an aññāta ñassāmi iti indriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññātau indriyam na sacchikarittha ati
translated: Does anyone who does not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown not realize the faculty of final knowledge?

original: Arahā anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha. Aṭṭha puggalā anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha.
analyzed: arahā anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam na bhāveti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha aṭṭha puggalāḥ anaññātaññassāmīti indriyam ca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarittha
translated: The Arahant does not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown, but he does realize the faculty of final knowledge. The eight kinds of persons do not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown, and they do not realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha so anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātau indriyam na sacchikarittha saḥ anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti iti
translated: Or does anyone who does not realize the faculty of final knowledge not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown?

original: Aṭṭhamako aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha, no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyaṁ na bhāveti.
analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ aññātau indriyam na sacchikarittha no ca anaññātaññassāmītindriyam na bhāveti
translated: The eighth person does not realize the faculty of final knowledge, but he does not not develop the faculty of understanding what is still unknown.

original: Aṭṭha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha anaññātaññassāmītindriyañca na🔽bhāventi. (Anaññātaññassāmītindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: aṭṭha puggalāḥ aññātau indriyañca na sacchikarittha an aññāta ñassāmi itindriyañca na  bhāventi
translated: (The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the basis for the following:)

original: Yo aññindriyaṁ na bhāveti so aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikaritthāti?
analyzed: yaḥ aññindriyam na bhāveti saḥ aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha ati
translated: “Who does not develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood? Does he not realize the faculty of final knowledge?”

original: Arahā aññindriyaṁ na bhāveti, no ca aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha. Cha puggalā aññindriyañca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha.
analyzed: arahā aññindriyam na bhāveti no ca aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha cha puggalāḥ aññindriyam ca na bhāventi aññātāvindriyam ca na sacchikarittha
translated: A perfected one does not develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood, but he does realize the faculty of final knowledge. Six persons do not develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood and do not realize the faculty of final knowledge.

original: Yo vā pana aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha so aññindriyaṁ na bhāvetīti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā pana aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha saḥ aññindriyam na bhāveti iti
translated: “Or who, realizing the faculty of final knowledge, does not develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood?”🔽Three persons who possess the path realize the faculty of final knowledge, but they do not develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.

original: Tayo maggasamaṅgino aññātāvindriyaṁ na sacchikarittha, no ca aññindriyaṁ na bhāventi.
analyzed: tayo magga samaṅgino aññātāvindriyam na sacchikarittha no ca aññindriyam na bhāventi
translated: Six persons realize neither the faculty of final knowledge nor do they develop the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.🔽(The faculty of understanding what has not been understood is the basis for the following:)🔽“Who does not develop the faculty of final knowledge? Does he realize the faculty of understanding what has not been understood?”

original: Cha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha aññindriyañca na bhāventi. (Aññindriyamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: cha puggalā aññātāvindriyañca na sacchikarittha aññindriyañca na bhāventi aññindriya mūlaka
translated: A perfected one does not develop the faculty of final knowledge, but he does realize the faculty of understanding what has not been understood. Six persons do not develop the faculty of final knowledge and do not realize the faculty of understanding what has not been understood.
